title: Introducing the 'Knee Rescue' seat: Adjustable seat provides more legroom
text:
Introducing the 'Knee Rescue' seat: Adjustable seat provides more legroom Last updated 13:23, August 10 2015 BE/Aerospace 
The adjustable seat can move backwards or forwards to create more legroom. 
A new plane seat design could be everything a tall, cramped flier could ever wish for. 
Nicknamed the "the Knee-Rescue Seat" by Skift.com , this revolutionary seat by B/E Aerospace is adjustable, meaning it can be moved forward or backwards, depending on the height of the passenger. 
Cabin crew can control the movement of the seats, increasing the space for a long-legged passenger who is seated in front of a child, or a shorter person. 
The design also benefits children, bringing them closer to the tray table in front of them. 
"The 'one size fits all' seating arrangement can cause discomfort for tall passengers, while a child or relatively small adult may be seated in an identical seat with more than ample leg room and in relative comfort." said the seat designers in their patent application. 
WATCH: Is it OK to recline your seat on a plane? 
BRING ON THE SEAT SQUEEZE 
The battle for legroom continues as airlines around the world look to squeeze in extra seats, creating the need for devices like the Knee Defender . 
This seat design, however, is less controversial and provides "a method of seating passengers according to height, and then adjusting the spacing of the seat to accommodate the height of the passenger in each seat". 
"Even a relatively small incremental increase in seat spacing for the tall passengers can provide additional comfort with no loss of comfort to the much smaller passengers seated in front of the tall passengers." added B/E Aerospace.
